Language isn #8217;t the barrier it used to be. There #8217;s a lot of mutual intelligibility between language families and these connections can create a sense of unity if kindled right. All languages in Europe should be coequal. We should focus on improving the direct translating system in the parliament and improve language learning in schools across the union. I propose that people learn English of course, then either German or French and also 1 language of a State that your state borders. So for example, I #8217;m from Denmark, so I would learn English, then I #8217;d choose German because that #8217;s right to the south and then I #8217;d choose Swedish, again because of proximity. But if you #8217;re for example polish you might learn English, then French and then Czech.
Firstly, there #8217;s no such thing as a Swiss language. Secondly, no, I said that you can choose between one #9757; #65039;of the languages of the neighboring states.

If you ask me we have got to be opportunistic in our approach. We have been way too direct in how we are proceeding and I think it has made ordinary people a little uncomfortable, with the idea of more EU. We have got to wait for the right moments to take these steps. Step 1): improve Union democracy. To increase faith and loyalty to the idea of european unity, we have got to create a representative system that people know they can trust. This means, remove the state governments from power and let the people choose our leaders. Tackle corruption and pass transparency laws to end lobbyism and profiteering. And create common news media that is easily accessible to all EU citizens, to inform citizens about the decisions that occur at the union level. Step 2): Begin further integration in key areas. Begin to integrate in the areas where we have the stronger argument, like for example defense. It makes total sense to have common security, when our economies are so interdependent that an attack on one, would disrupt trade in the rest. Also no one can seriously argue that an EU country should fear an invasion from another. Another area is if not fiscal union, then at least fiscal agreements. This is of course to fix the fatal flaw of the euro, but idk if improved democracy would be enough to convince the North/west to help the South/East, that #8217;s something we can work on. Of course there are many steps, but I think that #8217;s a good starting point and these should be worked on for the next 10-20 years, before we can move on to the next steps. Step 3, would probably be a constitution or a collective foreign policy.
Allow it, of course. Anything else would be counterproductive and only serve to prove the nationalists right and hurt the cause.
We can all agree that it should not be our 1st priority, but it is still a no-brainer and is something we can start working on in tandem with solving the democracy deficit

Most people see cultural differences, but we federalists see the similarities. To me, the cultural map of Europe is more of a gradient pattern than hard lines. The thing is we need to unite to protect our common interests. We aren #8217;t the great powers we used to be and we are becoming increasingly irrelevant on the international scene. We can use a federal Europe reestablish ourselves as a force not to be trifled with. Things like defense, monetary and fiscal policy should therefore be handled by the federal government, but otherwise we should leave as much as possible to the individual states

I #8217;m personally a federalist and no one is arguing that anyone should have the power to cede a territory other than the people living in that territory. I come from a small country, so I wanted to increase the international influence of my country by joining together with others and I started by supporting pan-Scandinavia. But it changed to pan-Europe because i view Austria and by extension Germany as my second home, due to all the skiing vacations I #8217;ve had there and I speak the language. But if it was a pan-Germanic Union, that would be too dominated by Germany and I was also very interested in Greco-Roman culture so it made sense to do a Europe-wide Union.

I #8217;m personally a proponent of the eagle, but if not then a bull. It could represent the Greek myth of Europa and the bull, but also the Norse story of the bull (Au #240;umbla) that licked the gods into existence
